ac.soton.gdp.lifeguide

Class Attribute

  • java.lang.Object
    • ac.soton.gdp.lifeguide.Attribute

  • public class Attribute
extends java.lang.Object
    An object which acts as a basic data store for the various attribute within a TrialDefinition.
    Since:
    1.7
    Author:
    Liam de Valmency (lpdv1g10@ecs.soton.ac.uk), Aleksandar Botev (ab9g10@ecs.soton.ac.uk), Dionisio Perez-Mavrogenis (dpm3g10@ecs.soton.ac.uk), Kim Svensson (ks6g10@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Attribute()
      Constructs an empty Attribute object, with no name, no groups and no weight.
      Attribute(java.lang.String attributeName, int numGroups, float weight, boolean isGroupingFactor)
      Constructs an Attribute object with the specified name, number of groups, and weight.
      Attribute(java.lang.String attributeName, java.util.List<Group> ranges, float weight, boolean isGroupingFactor)
      Constructs an Attribute object with the specified name, set of range values, and weight.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Attribute

        public Attribute()
        Constructs an empty Attribute object, with no name, no groups and no weight.

      • Attribute

        public Attribute(java.lang.String attributeName,
         int numGroups,
         float weight,
         boolean isGroupingFactor)
        Constructs an Attribute object with the specified name, number of groups, and weight.
        Parameters:
        attributeName - The string ID of the attribute.
        numGroups - The number of groups this represents (e.g. the 'smokes' attribute would have 2 groups, 'yes' and 'no').
        weight - The weight of this attribute, for use in minimisation to allow the attribute's value to have a greater influence on the balancing function.
        isGroupingFactor - Whether this attribute acts as a stratifying factor in randomisation, or a balancing factor in minimisation·

      • Attribute

        public Attribute(java.lang.String attributeName,
         java.util.List<Group> ranges,
         float weight,
         boolean isGroupingFactor)
        Constructs an Attribute object with the specified name, set of range values, and weight.
        Parameters:
        attributeName - The string ID of the attribute.
        ranges - A list of Group objects, each representing a bounded set of values for the attribute responses (e.g. the 'age' attribute might have ranges <20, 20-50 and >50).
        weight - The weight of this attribute, for use in minimisation to allow the attribute's value to have a greater influence on the balancing function.
        isGroupingFactor - Whether this attribute acts as a stratifying factor in randomisation, or a balancing factor in minimisation·

      • isGroupingFactor

        public boolean isGroupingFactor()

      • getGroupIndex

        public int getGroupIndex(float value)
        Gets the index of the given attribute response, within the list of possible responses for this attribute.
        Parameters:
        value - The participant's response value for this attribute.
        Returns:
        If the attribute is a raw value attribute (e.g. the responses are banded into ranges of integers), this returns the index of that range group within the list of groups. Otherwise, it is assumed that the responses are simply indexed from 0 to the number of groups, so the given participant value is converted to an integer and returned.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Checks whether the attribute is valid for use in a trial.
        Returns:
        The validity of the attribute within the context of a trial. To be considered valid, the attribute must have a non-empty, non-null name, and at least one group.

      • isRawValue

        public boolean isRawValue()
        Returns:
        Whether or not the attribute represents a raw-value response (e.g. 'age' response would be the number of years, banded into groups), or simply a list of groups (e.g. 'smokes' would have two groups, 'yes' and 'no').

      • setAttributeName
